cleaned_text: Clinical Assistant for Physical Therapy Sport Medicine - Requisition #: 144952 - Location: Cincinnati, OH - Posting Date: 8/5/2023 Description Clinical Assistant for Physical Therapy/Sports Medicine at Main Hospital 40 hours/week, Monday-Friday At Cincinnati Children's, we come to work with one goal: to make children's health better. We believe in a holistic team approach, both in caring for patients and their families, and in advancing science and discovery. We strive to do better and find energy and inspiration in our shared purpose. If you want to be the best you can be, you can do it at Cincinnati Children's. Cincinnati Children's Hospital Has Been Named: #1 in the Nation by U.S. News & World Report's Best Children's Hospitals Rankings A Top Hospital and Health System for Diversity recognized by DiversityInc Recognized as one of the Best Employers for New Grads by Forbes One of nation's most innovative companies by Fortune, March 2023 LGBTQ+ Healthcare Equality Top Performer in 2022 by The Human Rights Campaign (HRC) In sports and orthopedic physical therapy, Cincinnati Children's offers each athlete personalized care utilizing the most up-to-date research and therapists who specialize in pediatric musculoskeletal injuries. Working closely with Sports Medicine and Orthopedic physicians, we create a team that gets the athlete back safely and quickly. Each child receives a personalized evaluation and treatment plan made and carried out by your physical therapist throughout their care. We work with the child and family to ensure continuity of care with your physician to achieve the best outcomes. We are recruiting a Clinical Assistant for Physical Therapy/Sports Medicine at Main Hospital. The Clinical Assistant will help coordinate patient appointments, prepare rooms and groups for therapy, clean toys, and general office tasks. Qualifications: Experience working with children is ideal. Pay: $17.00/hour Market Leading Benefits Including: Medical coverage starting day 1 of employment Company paid pension plan and optional 403(b) supplemental retirement plans Paid Time Off Tuition reimbursement for continuing education Expansive employee discount programs through our many community partners Referral bonus program for current staff Support through Employee Resource Groups Physical and mental health wellness programs Cincinnati Children's is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and treasures Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion.
